intro: Synthyris stellata, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other familiar plants like willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Synthyris stellata typically grows in moist, shady areas such as forests and stream banks. It has thin, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds.
